CatDescriptText: Mr. Willis Walker, city employee, 1800 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 12, 1957, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think the Little Rock, Ark. school integration incident will gain more financial support for the NAACP in its continuing fight for equal rights?"  Answer reads: "Yes, I do. By all means it should gain more financial support for the NAACP because it demonstrates that the Federal Government will take a stand on constitutional rights for all citizens and we, as Negroes, should take a stand for our own self-respect."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Willis Walker standing in front of building with glass block window and sign that reads "...OOM"
